org.hawaiiframework.validation

Class ValidationResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hawaiiframework.validation.ValidationResult

  • public class ValidationResult
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores validation errors for a specific object.

    This class is heavily inspired on Spring's org.springframework.validation.Errors interface. The main difference is that Hawaii's ValidationResult does not bind or require the target object being validated.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Marcel Overdijk, Rutger Lubbers

      • rejectField

        public <T> FieldRejection<T> rejectField(java.lang.String field,
                                         T actual)
        Reject a field with value actual in a fluent manner. For instance:
        validationResult.rejectField("houseNumber", "13-a") .whenNull() .orWhen(containsString("a")) .orWhen(h -> h.length() > 4);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value.
        Parameters:
        field - The field name to evaluate.
        actual - The value to evaluate.
        Returns:
        a new field rejection.
